text: Act only according to that maxim whereby you can at the same time will that it should become a universal law.
author: Immanuel Kant

text: The greatest happiness of the greatest number is the foundation of morals and legislation.
author: Jeremy Bentham

text: Let justice roll down like waters, and righteousness like an ever-flowing stream.
author: Amos 5:24 (Bible)

text: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Do what is right, not what is easy.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: The arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends toward justice.
author: Theodore Parker (popularized by MLK Jr.)

text: Faith does not make things easy, it makes them possible.
author: Luke 1:37 (Bible)

text: Let yourself be silently drawn by the strange pull of what you really love. It will not lead you astray.
author: Rumi

text: Do to others as you would have them do to you.
author: Luke 6:31 (Bible)

text: Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier.
author: Mother Teresa (Saint)

text: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: We must learn to live together as brothers or perish together as fools.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: Power concedes nothing without a demand. It never did and it never will.
author: Frederick Douglass

text: Blessed are the peacemakers, for they will be called children of God.
author: Matthew 5:9 (Bible)
